channel.title: triple j: hack highlights
channel.description: Interested in current affairs, health issues, music, politics or culture? Have the best bits of Hack (triple j's current affairs half-hour) sent directly to you every weekday.
channel.itunes:author: triple j
channel.itunes:summary: Interested in current affairs, health issues, music, politics or culture? Have the best bits of Hack (triple j's current affairs half-hour) sent directly to you every weekday.
channel.itunes:keywords: australian, music, triple j, radio, news, current affairs, journalism, kate o'toole

item.title: triple j's hack: HSC Exam Anxiety
item.description: Hack catches up with students at Sydney Secondary College after their first HSC exam. This story was first broadcast on triple j on 21/10/2009

enclosure.length: Hack catches up with students at Sydney Secondary College after their first HSC exam.

item.itunes:subtitle: HSC Exam Anxiety

item.title: triple j's hack: Wild Rivers

item.title: triple j's hack: Indie Music Institution Closes Its Doors!
item.description: An icon of the Australian live music scene has shut its doors! There's been a massive outpouring of emotion online, with a facebook group attracting more than 5500 members - all trying to figure out how to save the 'Hopetoun Hotel'. This story was first broadcast on triple j on 02/10/2009

enclosure.length: An icon of the Australian live music scene has shut its doors! There's been a massive outpouring of emotion online, with a facebook group attracting more than 5500 members - all trying to figure out how to save the 'Hopetoun Hotel'.

item.itunes:subtitle: Indie Music Institution Closes Its Doors!
item.itunes:summary: An icon of the Australian live music scene has shut its doors! There's been a massive outpouring of emotion online, with a facebook group attracting more than 5500 members - all trying to figure out how to save the 'Hopetoun Hotel'.

item.title: triple j's hack: Sexism, time-wasting and Fred Flintstone: A rowdy week in Federal Question Time.
item.description: Have you ever tuned in to Question Time hoping to see the Opposition grill K-Rudd and the gang, only to think our nation's leaders are more like a pack of screaming school kids? (AAP: Alan Porritt, file photo) This story was first broadcast on triple j on 18/09/2009

enclosure.length: Have you ever tuned in to Question Time hoping to see the Opposition grill K-Rudd and the gang, only to think our nation's leaders are more like a pack of screaming school kids? (AAP: Alan Porritt, file photo)

item.itunes:subtitle: Sexism, time-wasting and Fred Flintstone: A rowdy week in Federal Question Time.
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever tuned in to Question Time hoping to see the Opposition grill K-Rudd and the gang, only to think our nation's leaders are more like a pack of screaming school kids? (AAP: Alan Porritt, file photo)

item.title: triple j's hack: From Lyneham with love.
item.description: Welcome to Lyneham, a leafy old suburb in Canberra's inner-north. Visit the cafes and shops and say hello to the students and artists who call this suburb home. But rug up in Winter or you'll freeze in one of the old fibro houses or Guvvie flats and beware those dark alleys at night! This story was first broadcast on triple j on 16/09/2009

enclosure.length: Welcome to Lyneham, a leafy old suburb in Canberra's inner-north. Visit the cafes and shops and say hello to the students and artists who call this suburb home. But rug up in Winter or you'll freeze in one of the old fibro houses or Guvvie flats and beware those dark alleys at night!

item.itunes:subtitle: From Lyneham with love.
item.itunes:summary: Welcome to Lyneham, a leafy old suburb in Canberra's inner-north. Visit the cafes and shops and say hello to the students and artists who call this suburb home. But rug up in Winter or you'll freeze in one of the old fibro houses or Guvvie flats and beware those dark alleys at night!

item.title: triple j's hack: First home buyers' land or Legoland? A tour of Canberra's north-western mortgage-belt.
item.description: Welcome to Gungahlin, where it seems a new suburb goes up every day on the back of the Rudd Government's First Home Owners Boost and the lowest interest rates in almost 50 years. Don't you know there's never been a better time to buy? This story was first broadcast on triple j on 10/09/2009

enclosure.length: Welcome to Gungahlin, where it seems a new suburb goes up every day on the back of the Rudd Government's First Home Owners Boost and the lowest interest rates in almost 50 years. Don't you know there's never been a better time to buy?

item.itunes:subtitle: First home buyers' land or Legoland? A tour of Canberra's north-western mortgage-belt.
item.itunes:summary: Welcome to Gungahlin, where it seems a new suburb goes up every day on the back of the Rudd Government's First Home Owners Boost and the lowest interest rates in almost 50 years. Don't you know there's never been a better time to buy?

item.title: triple j's hack: Hack's Burb Blurb Map
item.description: Love your suburb? Send Hack a 'BURB BLURB, and tell us why you dig it. And we'll add it to our Suburban map. We're getting ready for our week-long look at Australian Suburbs: Paradise or Prison. Suburbs Week: 7-11 September. This story was first broadcast on triple j on 10/09/2009

enclosure.length: Love your suburb? Send Hack a 'BURB BLURB, and tell us why you dig it. And we'll add it to our Suburban map. We're getting ready for our week-long look at Australian Suburbs: Paradise or Prison. Suburbs Week: 7-11 September.

item.itunes:summary: Love your suburb? Send Hack a 'BURB BLURB, and tell us why you dig it. And we'll add it to our Suburban map. We're getting ready for our week-long look at Australian Suburbs: Paradise or Prison. Suburbs Week: 7-11 September.

item.title: triple j's hack: From Mogadishu to Melbourne - Somalia in the suburbs
item.description: Can you imagine going from Somalia, to a refugee camp in Kenya, to the suburbs of Melbourne? This story was first broadcast on triple j on 08/09/2009

enclosure.length: Can you imagine going from Somalia, to a refugee camp in Kenya, to the suburbs of Melbourne?

item.title: triple j's hack: Escaping the 'burbs!
item.description: "It's not like 'sweet, lets go see a gig'. It's like 'sweet, lets go sit in a paddock'" - Ryan Moore, 17. This story was first broadcast on triple j on 08/09/2009
item.itunes:subtitle: Escaping the 'burbs!
item.itunes:summary: "It's not like 'sweet, lets go see a gig'. It's like 'sweet, lets go sit in a paddock'" - Ryan Moore, 17.

item.title: triple j's hack: Hack feature: Hearing Voices
item.description: When Ron went mad in Mel's mind she went from dux of her school to being a danger to herself and her family. Find out about a new way voice hearers are surviving. This story was first broadcast on triple j on 03/09/2009

channel.item:
triple j's hack: Boys & Girls - Meet the Third Gender http://mpegmedia.abc.net.au/triplej/hack/faafafine_m1780871.mp3 Not really a boy, not really a girl, not 'trans' of any kind. Somewhere between all those identities exists a third gender.
I'm talking about the Samoan Fa'afafine or 'FAFA'. This story was first broadcast on triple j on 25/08/2009 <enclosure url="http://mpegmedia.abc.net.au/triplej/hack/faafafine_m1780871.mp3" length="Not really a boy, not really a girl, not 'trans' of any kind. Somewhere between all those identities exists a third gender.
I'm talking about the Samoan Fa'afafine or 'FAFA'." type="audio/mpeg" /> Tue, 25 Aug 2009 00:00:00 +1000 Boys & Girls - Meet the Third Gender Not really a boy, not really a girl, not 'trans' of any kind. Somewhere between all those identities exists a third gender.
I'm talking about the Samoan Fa'afafine or 'FAFA'. 4:00
